comments:
I don't know what caused this (I was creating a new XMPPS connection to a server which did not have an XMPPS connection, as well as to GoogleTalk). I also tried to connect to IRC on irc.eclipse.org (except that I don't have a userid for that) and open a shared conference.

Still, I hope the stacktrace will give you a call path that you can use to figure out why this was logged.

Yeah, I see the problem here, Alex. I'm not familiar with that code but I do see what's up. ;) Looks like there's going to be a lot of those whilst one's typing up their connection information.

Setting target milestone as 1.0.1 because no one likes having huge log files.
Fixed in IRC UI.  XMPP doesn't have exact analog...if you have log entries like this for XMPP in your log could you attach one to this bug?  Thanks.

When I noticed this bug, it was after I had set up an XMPP entry and also an IRC one for shared groups, so I don't know which it would have come from. It was the only NPE in my log though. Will let you know if I have any further NPEs relating to either in a future bug.

(In reply to comment #3)
> When I noticed this bug, it was after I had set up an XMPP entry and also an
> IRC one for shared groups, so I don't know which it would have come from. It
> was the only NPE in my log though. Will let you know if I have any further NPEs
> relating to either in a future bug.

OK, I think this is limited to the IRC provider then...and is now fixed.  If any others of this kind appear, please reopen.  Thanks Alex.
